result.execSummary:
The defendant Tony R Daniels was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carrying A Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Endangering Safety By Use Of Dangerous Weapon (Under The Influence Of Intoxicant)

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Sign up for probation no later than 10/28/2022.

miscConds.notes:
Complete a firearm safety course.
Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.

No firearms except during the firearm safety course.
No prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
No violations of the law rising to the level of probable cause.

Submit a DNA sample by 10/28/2022 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tony R Daniels

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tony R Daniels in court.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Tony R Daniels.  Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
AS TO COUNT 1 -Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purpose of sentencing. 

AS TO COUNT 2 - Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  
*
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
Defendant ordered to serve 60 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 1 day time served, Huber Privileges for work. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 6 months with the following conditions:

- Sign up for probation no later than 10/28/2022.
- Complete a firearm safety course. 
- No firearms except during the firearm safety course.
- No prescription drugs without a valid prescription
- Obtain/maintain full time school/work.
- Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.
- No violations of the law rising to the level of probable cause.
- Submit a DNA sample by 10/28/2022 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.
*********
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, filed.  rmm
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights and Addendum, filed.  rmm

Case set for plea and sentencing.  No appearance by the defendant.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed until the next court date.  Case adjourned to Br. 1.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 10:45 am.

OFF THE RECORD.  Status conference held.  Atty. Wentz requests a plea and sentencing date.Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Tony R Daniels in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for status conference. Defendant wish to retain private counsel. Defense will remains as counsel until defendant has retained counsel. Case remains calendared in Br. 01 for a status of counsel.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Tony R Daniels in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Case calendared for Status Conference this date.  Court does not have a reporter this morning.  Matter adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Tony R Daniels in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Wentz has received discovery and an offer and would like time to review it.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Status conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Tony R Daniels in court.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 01.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 01 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
